solution_line_template: After the first spray kills {first_spray_kill}% of germs, there will be {total_percent} - {first_spray_kill} = <<{total_percent}-{first_spray_kill}={after_first}>>{after_first}% left.

The second spray kills {second_spray_kill}%, but {overlap_kill}% have already been killed by the {first_spray_kill}% spray, so it kills {second_spray_kill} - {overlap_kill} = <<{second_spray_kill}-{overlap_kill}={second_unique_kill}>>{second_unique_kill}%.
After the second spray kills {second_unique_kill}% of the remaining germs, there will be {after_first} - {second_unique_kill} = <<{after_first}-{second_unique_kill}={after_both}>>{after_both}% left.
